For example, Lagakos and Waugh (2011) allow skill to be correlated for working inside and outside of agriculture. Mulligan and Rubinstein (2008) do the same for working in the home sector and in the market, and argue for changing selection of high ability U.S. women into the market over time.
One could also investigate groups in other countries. Hnatkovska, Lahiri and Paul (2011) look at castes in India and find narrowing differences in education, occupations, and wages in recent decades.
